body_html: Actually I'm also pretty sure that it's an incorrect usage of the Process class. It's not designed to be subclassed, but meant to be instantiated and used as an object (it accepts a callable, target argument, in its constructor). Its run method bootstraps the environment and only then runs the target.
body_text: Actually I'm also pretty sure that it's an incorrect usage of the Process class. It's not designed to be subclassed, but meant to be instantiated and used as an object (it accepts a callable, target argument, in its constructor). Its run method bootstraps the environment and only then runs the target.
body: Actually I'm also pretty sure that it's an incorrect usage of the `Process` class. It's not designed to be subclassed, but meant to be instantiated and used as an object (it accepts a callable, `target` argument, in its constructor). Its `run` method bootstraps the environment and only then runs the `target`.
